data.text: @TastyKeish stereotypes are wack. Gotta filter out the toxicity and keep it groovin'
@TheMCFaceman if you were following the thread that prompted this post- bruh.... it was so rude. and also using the stereotype of Black people tipping low as fact. I was so hurt.
@TastyKeish that misconception is on them then. They know the deal. Good service = good tips. When waiters have a chip on their shoulder, it's a lose-lose
@TheMCFaceman that too. and so many times they approach it as the customer "owes" then just from walking in the door.

@TastyKeish Isn't the onus on the employee to provide great service in order to be tipper? If there were no tipping, like in Europe, it would be included in the check. Also, it provides little incentive for the waiter to provide good service.

The onus can't and shouldn't be on the customer to collectively pay your rent. The onus should be on your employer. Channel those vibes to your congressperson and employer. I just want a burger. I tip because i appreciate you and i'm low key scared that I won't be treated well.
